student_player

Class UCTNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • student_player.UCTNode

  • class UCTNode
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing an Upper Confidence Tree (UCT) for use in Monte Carlo Tree search. Note that in order to save on memory, only moves are store in each node. To get the current state at a given node Moves are applied form the root to the current node to generate this state

    • Method Detail

      • backPropagate

        void backPropagate(byte[] result)
        Backpropagates the result of a default policy simulation back up to the root node. Note a win increments win score by 2, a draw increments by 1 and a loss increments by 0. Each simulation increments numSims by 2. (such that it doesn't appear that the win/sim ratio is twice what it is supposed to be
        Parameters:
        result - the result of the default policy

      • getStateValue

        double getStateValue()
        Calculates the value of this state given it's win score, the number of simulations and the number of simulations of it's parent
        Returns:
        this state's value

      • getMaxSimsChild

        UCTNode getMaxSimsChild()
        Returns the child node that had the most simulations run on it. (this is the most promising next step)
        Returns:
        child node with most simulations

      • getState

        PentagoBitBoard getState(PentagoBitBoard startState)
        Generates a PentagoBitBoard state by applying moves from root to this node. (design choice to minimize memory usage)
        Parameters:
        startState - the current state of the game (state at the root).
        Returns:
        the state at this node
